Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: livinginpenang
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the F1 Sydney. We are a couple with 2 kids in primary. We found the room in perfect shape, basically it looked new. The beds, sheets and pillows were new and fresh. The room and bathroom were spotless. We were on the 6th (top) floor and heard no noise from within the Hotel, although the last night we did hear some noise from the street. A nice feature was the use of the common fridges and microwave where we stored and reheated food, which really helped keep our eating costs down. The front desk was helpful and checkin and checkout went without a hitch. There is a Coles just 5 minutes up the hill. I don't recommend using the small convenience stores down the hill as they are incredibly expensive and don't even both to display the price of items! They are basically a rip off. My kids loved the bunk beds, even fighting over who got the top bunk. There was a tiny TV which worked fine, and the Air Con. ran well and quietly. I really cannot complain about anything, especially given the fact that we had a mid-week special of $69 a night or so. For that money I cannot complain.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Formule 1 Kings Cross Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was dirty. Several rooms smelt strongly of insect spray. Shower flow was a trickle. Very disappointed after a good previous experience at Hotel Formule 1 Auckland Airport

Reviews.Title: “Stinky room and incompetent reception service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were moldy and stinky, we could not open the window to let the air in. The receptionist was very incompetent and rude, I felt almost insulted- he didnt speak well English either. Definitely not my choice for the next stay

Reviews.Title: “If cleanliness is next to godliness, this place is hell!”
Reviews.Author: kwdn
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend this hotel to anybody. When we arrived our room smelt terrible and the air conditioner (which was in desperate need of a clean) wouldn't turn on. The staff were quite quick to fix this though. The room was tiny, just enough room for the bed and a small bathroom. The windows were bolted shut, signs about theft plastered all over the room but no safe provided in the room. In the bathroom you almost have to shower over the toilet and the water did not drain from the bathroom floor. The blankets were full of long black hairs. There was carpet glued to the bottom of the walls instead of skirting boards which was falling off. No "do not disturb" signs provided, so every morning we were woken up by housekeeping. Only one powerpoint in the entire room, which was underneath the TV and a tiny mirror stuck to the wall above it. To top it all off, we checked out at 5am and when we walked outside I realised that I had forgotten to hand back one of the swipe cards for our room. I spoke to reception on the intercom asking if I could come back inside to hand it in but I was told "Don't worry about it, you can keep it". Maybe this is contributing to the high theft rates.... I cannot think of any good things to say about the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean enough”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The place was dirty - the kitchen was dirty as well as the shower/toilet in the room. The service was good but they need to make sure that everything in clean

Reviews.Title: “Cost effective value.”
Reviews.Author: delmsie Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As described. Simple basic accommodation at a very fair price. Close to transport and amenities. Just what I needed clean beds and a shower. I needed a place to sleep and shower and that was all. If your after flash and luxury this is not for you but if you just need a place to sleep at a good price this is just what you need. YES I would be happy to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok.... if you have no sense of smell”
Reviews.Author: GotaBigFamily
Reviews.Content: 2 good points - price & location 2 bad points - smell & cleanliness Stayed for 2 nights in a room with 2 sets of bunks, even though the room we ordered online stated a double & single bed. Ended up settling for the 4th room we tried (1st - filthy bathroom, 2nd - leaking aircon soaked through carpet, 3rd - couldn't handle the stench, 4th - over moving so had to suck it up). The staff were ok but we swear the guy was watching a porno at reception (we heard it but couldn't see it) but then again this is the Cross! On the last night he was actually really good at pointing out which hookers were male vs female and giving live updates etc so it was kinda fun. The hotel stored our luggage at reception after check-out for free which was appreciated. Overall: cheap & kinda nasty, would stay here again only if the alternatives were the nazzzzty backpackers where the hookers hang! Definitely not a place for elderly or kids (of any age!).

Reviews.Title: “Everyone else is right- it smells.”
Reviews.Author: threebluekids
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here with much trepidation, but the room was booked and the $99 paid. I actually thought everyone must have been a bit sensitive and it couldn't really be THAT bad, could it? I was wrong! It is in a great location, our room had views of the bridge and Opera House out of our small, non opening window. We were initially bamboozled by the lack of space to stop our car out the front, but luckily ended up in the narrow one-way lane at the back of the building that has 1 hour parking, and access to the tiny car park, in which we scored a park- a wonderful thing in this city! Check in was easy and the staff pleasant, but there the good stuff ends. We stepped into the lift and the stink of cigarettes, and general dirtiness began. The hallway was marginally better, but nothing compared to the room itself. I would say if you buried your face in someone else's sweaty jogger you might have a good idea what it was like. Even with the noisy aircon on it wasn't any better. The room had a queen and a set of bunks, and wasn't really all that tiny. The beds were hard, but the sheets clean. The bathroom was tiny, and the once-was-white shower curtain was black with mould and filth. It really was pretty poor. It is such a pity as it could be a great little hotel- I just can't understand how they can let the place become so gross. The management was really nice, and I know the price is low, but surely some room deoderiser and a cheapy shower curtain could be included for less than that. I wont be back to find out though.

Reviews.Title: “Only good price”
Reviews.Author: Fershtet
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is price. Even it is located just 5 minutes walking from Hydepark the location is aweful. The rooms are poor. There is absolutely nothing in rooms. The first floor is dirty og smells. The staff are ok. I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: TokaraSC
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned as to what to expect based on other reviews, but our group of four couldn't go past $130 or so per night. We had a family room (one double bed and one bunk bed) on the sixth floor. The room (although sparse) was clean, the staff were helpful and friendly, and we had a view of the harbour and Sydney Harbour Bridge. The only thing wrong with the room was that the bathroom door lock was broken, which meant the door itself could just be pulled in but wouldn't actually click closed (but this didn't cause us any problems). Very easy walk to nearby Kings Cross Station. We didn't have the hotel breakfast, preferring to go to Subway (on the way to the train station). Would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it was so bad, even the management agreed and gave me a refund of my money, dirty room, it smelled really bad, no opening windows as advertised , airconditioner leaked water all over my sons luggage, only good thing was the view from the window, which was tiny and grimey

Reviews.Title: “My banking details were skimmed at the reception desk.”
Reviews.Author: murray e Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in October. When I passed my credit card to the reception to pay for my room, they skimmed my card without me knowing it. One month after leaving the hotel while reviewing my bank statements I saw a dozen transactions using western union Sydney totaling $7000. sending money from my account overseas. I am in the process of trying to recover the money.

Reviews.Title: “Anwhere but here!”
Reviews.Author: SWF_11
Reviews.Content: I made the stupid mistake of staying here when the NRL Grand final was on. The hotel was full of rowdy, drunk, young men. And that is when I realised I made a mistake of choosing this for my two night stay in Sydney. On first glance, the room and bathroom looked reasonably clean. However, when I asked the staff member at the reception desk for extra bedding he came to my room with extra blankets then left suddenly; I found out why shortly after. The blankets were covered in long human hairs of different colours and cigarette burns. When I pulled back the bedspread the blanket on the bed was also covered in human hair. When I pulled back the sheets I noticed lots of little unidentifiable black dots and a large faint pale yellow stain in the middle of the bed. When I complained to the staff member at the front desk he apologised and said he would bring me some clean bedding, but of course that never eventuated. By this time it was too late to find another hotel so I slept on one side of the bed with my tracksuit on over my pjs and my jacket covering me as I was cold. I switched the dual heating/air-conditioning unit on and it was full of dust, which made breathing difficult. I put up with situation for two nights at a total cost of $338.00 (I had to pay upfront and I was not entitled to a refund as I booked online). To say I was appalled is an understatement. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is the location as it is close to restaurants, shops, and transport. So my advice is simple: For no other reason (and I haven't even mentioned the smell of stale fast food that lingers in the hotel or the strong stench of vomit in the lift which lasted a whole night before it went away), stay at a hotel that offers clean bedding because it is the least you should expect from hotel accommodation and it is the least any hotel should be able to provide to its customers.

Reviews.Title: “very uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our trip was neither business or leisure. I had to go down for tests at St. Vincents hospital. The motel was nice & handy for that. Parking was advertised but when we got there, there was none available so we parked in the lane at the back. The staff were nice but the bathroom had mould all around the top of the walls in in the grout in the shower. Also the carpet was stained. The mattress was very uncomfortable. You could feel the springs. Also every time we moved, it made a noise. Apart from that the view was very good. I`d recommend it if it was cleaner & had a more comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but tired”
Reviews.Author: pan_viator
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking, so no advance booking discount, which made it a bit more expensive than I would normally pay. Still cheap by Sydney standards though. Rooms are tired and need refurbishing. The bed was comfortable and the shower room - toilet area was adequate for a budget hotel. Reception staff very friendly. Romm faced a main road but was quiet with the window shut, we even had a view of the bridge and opera house, well parts of it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Help Needed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reception area smelt of vomit! Breakfast area was untidy. Bedroom had the smell of stale sick! Noisy guests late at night, and the doors slam shut. Put teenagers on the lower floors, so security can see and hear them. Bedspreads need washing! Vending machines offering hot meals would be appreciated as not all wish to walk to the "Cross" at night

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hard to beat if you are just wanting an economical place to sleep and refresh.... Clean, comfortable bed - good shower - good TV channel selection Great location -walk to the CBD - train station - Kings Cross - cafe & restaurants are less than 5 minutes walk. Transport options include - Trains 6 minutes - Taxis always there - airport Shuttle service from hotel every 30minutes - Bus stop 5minutes. No fuss online booking - helpful front desk always. One minus is..... no in-room tea making facility.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting, the rooms are dirty, the pillow still consists many of short curved hair, the shower was shocking and my family did not get any sleep because we could not relax in this dirty place, the room was wet for long period because when the air-conditioner is running the condensed water continuous dripping causes all carpet wet and smell, we had complained to service desk, the answer is â€œnothing I can do, suggest to place more towels for absorptionâ€�, we need to quit, the answer is â€œbye byeâ€�. I think the Fomuler 1 is a good hotel and in promotion period, we booked and paid for 4 nights, we were just staying there (Rm 506) one night then quit to other hotel, now I understand that why this hotel has no cancellation & refund, I am the Accorhotel membership, why this type of hotel is still on the list of the Accorhotel booking?, it is the worst hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Lower your expectations to your budget.”
Reviews.Author: Angela S
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 spent a week here. The room was adequate (we were sleeping and showering there) and an ideal base to explore Sydney from. The staff were friendly and helpful and we had nothing to complain about. If you are expecting resort conditions pay for a resort.

Reviews.Title: “depressing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: nothing i can say that would make any body rush to make a booking.no where to hang clothes one broken chair, no refrigeration to store drinks,no facilities to make a tea or coffee not even a glass to use.will now even consider otherhotel chains to use dissapointed and depressing

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: LilFlatFoot Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting. The rooms are dirty, the shower was shocking and my hisband I did not get any sleep because we could not relax in this dirty place. We would have changed hotels however we were just staying here one night before we left for Fiji. It was a good thing we had our sleeping bags with us because that is what we slept in.

Reviews.Title: “can be better”
Reviews.Author: omega747 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: ok. mirrors need to be better placed for women. i booked a family room,looked like a normal room??was i given wrong room?? no remote for tv. towel for wet floor wouldve been handy place looks tired compared to mascot,strathfield and st peters.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: Jazza2011
Reviews.Content: Very unclean,Loud drunk people in the hallways all night until 6am very bad service and rude staff....Police were even called by another guest because of the amount of drunk people in hallways..Never again will I stay even if I was paid to!-10/10

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff, good location, nice view, not clean”
Reviews.Author: BusinesstravelerHam
Reviews.Content: I stayed 8 nights in this Hotel. The view from the front side is very good. Harbour Bridge and Opera House... Fantastic ! The rooms are ok and the staff is very friendly. The Breakfast cost 7 Dollar and is very poor. The Hotel is directly and Kings Cross and at the weekend (Friday and Saturday) is it very loud ! the rest of the week it is fine ..... This is Hotel is a real Budget Hotel and is totally overpriced! But in Sydney is everything very overpriced....

Reviews.Title: “Not again!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Dirty room, dirty bathroom, smell of smoke everywhere! Staff was ok, friendly and with knowledge about neighbourhood. Overall, the low price is not worth staying in this hotel. I suggest improvements in room services and refurbishment of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you work in the CBD and just want to sleep. The room is not designed for sloths. Most of the time I sleep well but occassional the late night party people can get noisy.Showers are pretty good although vary from room to room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and its really 'you get what you pay for'”
Reviews.Author: kerrob1624
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to thailand and found this hotel to be very cheap. We didnt expect much but it fell even lower than our expectations. Dingy, dark and very run down. with a musky smell. We had to go downstairs and ask for glasses so we could have a drink and we were given two paper cups. Limited channels on tv ( I think only 3) and we had no remote. Again had to go downstairs to ask for one and it was brought up over an hour later. The double bed was sagging badly on one side and I could feel the springs sticking into me. Staff were not interested in you and seemed busy on their computers. Once again, very cheap but would never stay there again. The positive side, it was just a stroll to the famous kings cross strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tery
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 3 youngish children so had two adjacent rooms, but they don't have interconnecting rooms. Got the rooms on special for $59.00 each per night which is a good price for vitually the city centre. The reception staff were unfailingly polite and helpful and we were able to park our car for only $20.00 a night. The rooms as per Formule 1 advertising are very basic and I mean very !!! The bed was lumpy and uncomfortable and the walls of the room were not particularly clean, but the position of the hotel makes it easy to get around and of course there are so many good restaurants and eating places around the area. if you want cheap and cheerful I can recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Budget price hotel with friendly efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Davewasere Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel as we were loking for an inexpensive stay in Sydney. We were just after a clean room with a bed and door that we could sleep in and we certainly got that. Hotels in this price range frequently come with unhelpful and undermotivated staff, and I would like to say that the staff at this hotel really were a present surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am pleased you contatced me for I was about to write to Accor. I have been a foundation member of Advantagea Plus 1995 and this was the worst experience: a) No Place to hang your clothes. No Hangers b) Stained sheets and old blanket c) Poor Lighting d) Thin small towels e) Old pillows Very Very Disgusted Signed Gary J Watts

Reviews.Title: “Very central, motel clean, value for money, good place only for a night's rest”
Reviews.Author: MerryTrouper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights.. But we were in the room only to sleep at night. The best thing is that it was very central and a 4 minute walk to Kings Cross Station, which links all of Sydney... Do not need to take a cab to noweher if you are staying here.. A clear budget hotel. The Sri lankan boys at the reception are very accommadating and young lads.. We were very happy with our decision to stay here given that we knew that we were not expecting anything much out of this.. We would recommend this anyday for the budget traveller!!

Reviews.Title: “NEEDS A HEALTH REVIEW”
Reviews.Author: Kryscooper
Reviews.Content: I seriously doubt humans could possibly stay safely in this place!!! My partner and I had decided to stay here after positive reviews form OTHER Formule 1 hotels..... they had CLEARLY never stayed here! I literally walked straight back out after walking in and seeing so much mould i thought something may grow and attack me during the night...cigarette burns in the bed sheets, no ventilation so i thought i would turn on the air con only to be blasted in the face with dust and stuck on mould.....i thought perhaps i would open a window as the stale stench of what could only be described as B.O and vomit was starting to make me light headed, only to be punched in the face with an even worse smell from the lovely view of the alleyway...im not sure what it was and i choose not to ever find out. I was scared when i was walking out of the room to find a powerpoint that looked as though it had recently been on fire and the elevator buttons...well...non existent... i could have played with the live wires but i decided against it..... a hotel cleaner joined me in the lift and i literally held my breath the whole way down (i dont think they know what deodorant is) I have been in a $46 a night backpackers and THAT was nicer than this place! I found another hotel (O'Malleys hotel) and had to have a shower as i felt ....well...slightly violated.... all in all i would rather sleep in the streets of Darlinghurst street than stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, slightly dated.”
Reviews.Author: Shortyman77
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay of 3 nights. Found the location excellent and the staff were friendly and helpful. Decor dated and in need of a bit of tlc but if you're after a cheap safe clean bed near the city centre you can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Okay as a last resort”
Reviews.Author: MikeyOz
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel - service at reception was slow - the room was quite shabby and the size of the bunk bed meant that you couldn't open the window for ventilation. Very cheap though by Sydney standards, so from that point of view - you get what you pay for. It is a bit of a walk to the CBD - however you can opt to head to Kings Cross train station to catch the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Base Camp!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay as a base for your trip to Sydney. Close to everything and reasonably priced. Not flash - but adequate for sleeping! Particularly good for going out in Kings Cross or Oxford Street.

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in this formula 1 as one of my staff stays reguley at the fromula 1 at Opympic Park and said it was great clean and comfortable hotel for 1 night , but Not the formula 1 at Kings Cross no handle on bathroom (completly missing), shower head spayed water all over the back wall so no water on person and this was in an upgraded room? MMMMMMMMMM Would never stay there and very hesitant to stay in a formula 1 again.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zlochevsky
Reviews.Content: just don't go there. so bad that I won`t waste time to write about it positive ponts: none negative points: alll you can find good deals by the same price. Ex. stay in Manly Lodge.. Much better.. 5 min walking to the ferry and 30 min by ferry in a wonderfull trip.. You can find many hotels (or hostels) that would be much better for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Bottom end of the budget range”
Reviews.Author: SimonWise
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at F1 before you know what to expect but this is one of teh poorest F1's I have stayed at. Generally tired and grubby.

Reviews.Title: “VERY TIRED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BugnBoo
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Formule 1 in France we were very disappointed from the second we got to the hotel entrance door. The two squashed cockroaches were there for both nights of our unfortunate stay. We had two rooms - our room had partial views of the Harbour Bridge/Opera House but the room itself was very poor. We requested a double room but it also had cheap/nasty bunk beds in too! No hairdryer either. Was not impressed with the cigarette burn on the bedding. The shower was good but not clean. The second room was poor and had a very unpleasant smell. We spent the minimal amount of time in the hotel that we could. The location was fine - walking distance to Darling Harbour and great for bus/train connections. This is the second and last ever stay with Accor hotel group - they really seem to have some very poor hotels within their group.

Reviews.Title: “good location, small but tidy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed the night of the BDO and it was all we needed, somewhere to sleep when we got home. staff were friendly, a bit noisy in the corridors, no parking on site was available that morning which meant we had to go to a nearby parking station would be good if they had a bath matt in the bathroom as it gets all wet one you've showered

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Formule1 hotel even if it is cheap”
Reviews.Author: Jutta0000
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights there, it wasn't a good experience. We had to choose this hotel because it was all that was basically left if you didnt want to pay 200+ /night. But if I've known what kind of a hotel it was a would have been glad to pay the 200+ to go somewhere else. Our first room smelled like urine. We had to go to ask for another room. There wer only few rooms left, we went to see those and the same smell was found there also. Finally the last room was less smelly so we had to settle with it. The batroom was dirty, as well as the carpet, a tiny tv there was also. The location however was excellent. During our 3 weeks aussieholiday we slept one night in the car also and I would recommend that over Formule1 hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT U C IS WHAT U GET”
Reviews.Author: BHAVIKA
Reviews.Content: i think that even though it wasnt a 5 star luxury hotel it was still a clean, simple and most off all honest hotel. It says that its a budget hotel clearly at the front entrance. so u get what u pay for. I stayed there for 4 weeks and i think that the accomodation was really good for the price i paid. The cleaners were really good aswell. Even though i wasnt there the whole day when i came back my stuff was still there. Overall i would go back if i was travelling on my own or if i was with my freinds, but i would not recommend it for a family holiday or for elderley people because it can get abit loud out there. It was really helpfull for me though because the manager was really nice he arranged a good value for me since i was staying for longer and plus he even waited for 2 days for me to pay because i had travellers cheques. The staff is really nice and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Big City Noise and Lights”
Reviews.Author: DeeBatman67
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for, some tips to make it more enjoyable... ear plugs...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what we needed and it was perfectly situated, we had amazing views of the bridge and opera house. Staff were very friendly and welcoming and acommodated all our needs to perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simple, clean, accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Needed 1 night stay near central Sydney & the room was clean, comfortable & well airconditioned. Parking on street is limited, service at front desk polite, elevators get there eventually & don't smell of urine like the fire stairs! A good step up from a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid unless you are broke.”
Reviews.Author: cultfigure
Reviews.Content: This place is a hostel - not a hotel. V depressing, grey walls, and bunk beds. It lloked like a jail cell and I half expected a screw to come and lock me in on an evening. No kettle. tea etc or any kind of basic style amenities. Everything - internet, laundry, soft drinks etc availaible at a premium to the point of rip off. Even luggage storage was 6 bucks. Room was clean but unless you are broke then stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “to stay one night rest”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: room with just a bed no fridge very poor service for the price

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Formula if you are traveling on a MAJOR BUDGET”
Reviews.Author: tinnyc
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hostel, but my guess is that this would be what to expect. We has a "quad' room for four people, and literally the room had 2 bunk beds (with sheets and blanket available). I've never had to make my own bed in a hotel. However, it was clean and close - and because of the lack of room we didn't spend a lot of time there. It was fine and I wouldn't have expected nicer for $25/night Aus.

Reviews.Title: “Kings Cross Formule 1”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Choose rooms at rear to avoid road noise - good value cafes within 200m for all meals - weekend rates a bit steep

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in Kings Cross. The area is full of restaurants and entertainments. The train station is very near. Plus the views are great. The rooms ar clean. The service at the front desk is really fantastic. They are very knowledgeable on places to go and eat. I will dfinitely go back on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't get to sleep for 3 nights !!!”
Reviews.Author: BabyKangaroo
Reviews.Content: We were told by the travel agent that the location of this hotel was terrific. I can't deny on that. It get easily access to all public transport. As it is so close to the nightlife district, it gets really noisy that you can't imagine. We arrived on Friday and our room is on Level 5. We got the view of Sydney Harbour bridge from far. Not bad, right... that's what we thought. As the aircon was too noisy, so we switched it off and open the window at night. From 11pm till 4 or 5am that night, we heard people was yelling, laughing, noise of drunk people. Then, siren from police car, ambulances arriving. etc. These noises went on from Friday till Sunday night. (Yes. the whole show stop earlier on Sunday night at about 2 or 3 am). My children was terrified and they couldn't sleep during the whole stay. The whole family was so restless and I would definately not choosing this hotel again. Especially if you are with children.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and central, good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: iheartaus
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Formule 1 Kings Cross and pretty much got what we expected. At only $89 a night we weren't expecting anything too special but we did find ourselves in a really handy location - a quick walk to Kings Cross station, Coles, and plenty of shops, bars and great food choices. Location was definitely my favourite part. The service was minimal but the staff at the front desk were always polite and helpful. Our room was a standard double and we found it had plenty of space. The ensuite was small with an open shower that tended to spray water everywhere but it was clean. Small TV and bed was comfy enough although we wished the windows would have opened. There is nothing really new here...there were marks on the carpet and walls which weren't pleasant but didn't really bother us. There are lockers to store your luggage if needed but you do have to pay - Internet is also a total rip off. If I was looking for a really cheap, simple place to stay I would try here again for a night or 2 but it's definitely not somewhere to go for a holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Local, inexpensive, and sweet as!”
Reviews.Author: nzpanz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of accomodation attached to our flights. It was in my opinion the equivalent to a K Road type of place (for NZders). It is 5 mins from China Town, Supermarket, Trains, Clubs and the Kings Cross str8. You can view the Sydney Bridge from outside and it is quite a neat hustle and bustle place. Look for the price its right! And I wouldnt take my kids there but there were children accompanying their parents, so its really up to you. I really liked this place and had no problems with annything there. Be mindful of the street workers who loiter around the area, and the many annoying people who ask for change JUST SAY NO!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and views, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Qlimax
Reviews.Content: Following the advice of previous reviews, I asked for a room that's on the high floors and was treated to a fantastic view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. For the price I paid (I got it during a special promotion at AUD$180 for three nights), it was above my expectations with its fantastic location, ensuite toilet, and an extremely spacious room that had a queen sized bed and an additional double bunk bed. Similar to various previous reviews, my hotel room window could not be opened, which was kinda unsettling to sleep in, especially since on the first night of my stay there, the fire alarm was activated and everyone had to be evacuated as the firemen came to tackle a false alarm. While this was all right for me, there were a few mature aged patrons that had difficulties climbing up and down the various flights of stairs. Overall, everything would be good except for the noisy crowd and traffic jam on the street in front of Hotel Formule 1 that leads into Kings Cross on Fridays and Saturdays. I would assume that there are a lot of teenage party revellers staying in the cheaper backpackers-style rooms that Hotel Formule 1 provides as well as the raucous that they created, screaming in the corridors at 1am drove a few patrons to wake up to shout at them. Overall, a decent stay for a night or two, but I wouldn't recommend it for a longer stay as there are no basic essentials such as a kettle to boil drinking water. And I definitely won't recommend it for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Budget”
Reviews.Author: wreckoftheday
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I paid A$500 for five nights. The location was good and central, about 5-10 mins walk to Kings Cross station. The area has a lot of eateries and clubs, while the hotel itself was not smack in the red light district. Room was basic but very big. Our room had a double bed and a double decker bunk bed, tv, a table and chair, some towels and that's about it. Just a note, there were no cups, kettle, hair dryer, toothpaste, soap and shampoo - so it's best to come prepared. Unlike other reviewers, our window could be opened. We also had an air conditioner/heater. For two people I thought it was very adequate; however if you are travelling with more people the room might be a bit cramp and the bathroom would be very wet. Noise can be an issuer for light sleepers as walls are very thin. Every day the room was made, even if we left at a late hour. And fresh towels are provided daily, so that's a plus. Also, we had a great view of the bridge and the opera house! Which was surprising for the price. The only downside for me was that the room felt a little dark as lighting was inadequate, and the carpet floor felt a bit dirty. The sheets and blankets also made my skin itchy. The room also exuded a strange "feeling" as well, which made me uneasy. But maybe it's just me. All in all, if you are traveling with a budget and don't plan on spending much time indoors in the hotel, this place will do the trick.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: fltatt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the formule 1 with my husband and two children and I must say that for the price I got exactly what I expected. No frills. It was clean, simple, friendly staff, affordable breakfast. perfect for a night stay if you are laying over prior or after a flight. I would'nt recommend it for an extended stay, but for a night it's perfect. Those that complain should simply stay in a more expensive hotel where they can get more extra. If on a budget or you are low maintenance, or just want to sleep... this is it! We paid $99.00 Every other hotel we saw, was starting at around $169. and further away. This is walking distance from SYD

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly staff, budget room and worth of money”
Reviews.Author: AmberTaipei
Reviews.Content: For the money I paid, I knew what to expect from the room. Although it doesn't have much facilites, but it was a good room and sound sleep. Staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “glorified backpackers”
Reviews.Author: ziggyzee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights,a Friday and a Saturday. Check in was standard,and i got the feeling it wouldnt be anything to luxurious,and it wasnt. My room was adequate size,it contained the bare basics,bed,tv,bathroom. No jug,no chair,no opening windows and the the bathroom flowed out everywhere when ya shower. Uncomfortable bed,thin cheap mattresses and old million times washed bedding. The room had some rotted patches in the carpet,and the pull down blind/shutter was covered in graffiti,some dating back to 2006 that im sure could be gone with a good clean. The Saturday night was quite bad,as this hotel is cheapish and a chain within the cross it gets full with teenagers and party goers on the weekend,and as they do dorm rooms that sleep 4 for the same price as a double,it turns into a party hotel. The place on Sat nite was noisy,and littered with alcohol cans and bottles in the halls and lift. Travelling as a single male it was just adequate,but not somewhere i would take a partner or recommend for peace,comfort of style. Its situated right on Williams Street,one of Kings Cross's main sex workers area and has constant traffic going past 24/7. For the price,theres a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “An A1 Backpacker/Budget Hotel in the right place”
Reviews.Author: lynnval
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our mid 60s. We usually select 3* hotels out of choice. This one surprised us on arrival because it was linked to an Air New Zealand deal and we had expected something else. We had booked for 6 nights. After a couple of days we tried the breakfast - excellent value and nice to have some interaction. As an engineer I could appreciate the design - everything was kept very simple but functional. We had a great harbour view and didn't mind the Williams Street noise too much. We've stayed in expensive apartments and hotels around Oz that have been depressing and untidy - everything in the room worked and it was clean and tidy. Clean towels every day. Fridges for food. Hot drinks at any hour from machines. Formula 1 seems to span the gap between budget hotel, backpacker, and youth hostel very well. We'd definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: melbournescot
Reviews.Content: Terrible value for what you get! Not even a sink plug to have a shave! Bathroom gets absolutely SOAKED when you have a shower....making floor very wet and dangerous. Speaking of danger, Windows were all screwed shut!! Rooms had air conditioning. No fresh air. Rooms badly needed airing!! Sirens blared all night! Very noisy in the streets and corridors!! The good side was, that the Staff were very friendly! Gr8 location for visiting the Cross. Gr8 people watching area! Good Food and Pubs around. We had a gr8 weekend all in all. Public Transport and Ferries were excellent value!! Each to their own I guess!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, great views, basic rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Lorks
Reviews.Content: This is pretty standard Motel, which boasts some of the cheapest accomodation in Sydney. It is never going to win any awards for it's facilities, which are as basic as they come, but it does boast some amazing views over the opera house and bridge, and it's only 10 minutes walk from Kings Cross train station and 20 from Hyde Park. The rooms are basic: after all, remember that although an Accor hotel, this place is one of their cheapst brands, lower than an Ibis. The bed is comfortable, and there is a bunk bed also wedged into the room. There is a TV (with just the 5 normal channels, plus a paid for film service) and a clock radio. That is the peak of refinements. The bathrooms are equally basic, with just a shower, a towel, and one bar of soap. The water flow from the taps is minute. The aircon, although new, is very noisy, and you can't open the window. There is no kettle, however there is a communal fridge on the second floor. Downstairs there are a couple of vending machines, and err, that's it really. There is no parking near the hotel. There are two main doors into the hotel, one on the main street (William Street), which goes up a narrow staircase, and one on the little layby which goes past the breakfast room and into the reception desk. Alas, this door is used as the hangout for some very dodgy people from Kings Cross: take care using it at night. Signs here as people not to drink alcohol in the doorway, but to little effect. You are better off using the lower staircase. One major annoyance is that the cleaners come round at 8am, and even if you leave a note on the door saying you are sleeping they will knock on your door to see if you really are still asleep. They will then knock again at 9am to see if you are up, and finally at 10am when they go off shift to see if you really, really, don't want your bin emptied. When checking in ask if you can have a view north, looking over the bridge: the higher up, the better the view. All in all, it's cheap, it's basic, but at AU$79, you really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Central, Good Budget Motel”
Reviews.Author: david092
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. It is convenient to rail station (walk 10 mins), Coles super market (walk 5 mins) and Hade Park (walk 20 mins ). Though it is near the red light zone, it is still a quiet and safe place. The room is clean but is small and boring too. As a tourist, we spend all day time outside, do not feel any difficult on this small room. It will be suitable for 3-4 budget persons.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, cheap and in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: 2Ad2Ch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great to stay in - very basic but what can you say for that price! We are a family of four and chose the room with two bunks. Didn't worry about the lack of view - we were out looking at Sydney all day, what does it matter if you can't see the bridge from your hotel room? The bathroom gets a bit messy after 4 showers but it dried quick. Breakfast was ample with plenty of choice. This is a large hotel but with carpark space for less than a dozen cars. This was our only complaint, really. We had to hike to K.C. Carpark but then that's a very safe carpark, so no real disadvantage there. The idiot in the next room decided to play loud music from early in the morning but you could encounter that in any hotel. I'd stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Filled a last (LAST) minute accommodation crisis”
Reviews.Author: traveloctopus
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a couple of Formule 1 Hotels in different countries (Australia, France, Germany), and had mixed experiences. But I know what to expect from the chain, and was happy with this place. After having a very difficult experience trying to get a refund (we had booked in two nights, as two different reservations; but they charged us for three nights) after my last Formule 1 stay from Formule 1/Accor's French/worldwide offices [eventually got a refund and a bit more; after speaking to six different customer consultants on three continents, dozens of e-mails, and a five month delay]; I was admittedly a little hesitant. Due to some unforseen circumstances, my touring party (four people, two couples) found ourselves without accommodation [staying with people fell through], at an extremely late hour (after 3am Wednesday, with a drive to Newcastle at 10am). We were able to book a room through reception at this hour, which was great. It's a very basic facility, but when kind of desperate for accommodation at 3am on a Wednesday night - luxury does not matter. What does matter is cleanliness, security, and efficiency. I found that this hotel passed these criteria for me. Unlike some Formule 1 Hotels, the room (4x bunk bed configuration) had a basic ensuite in the room, and free to air television channels. Beds were adequate taking into consideration the hotel/chain rating. Basic facilities, but dependable. It depends what you're looking for, ultimately.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, lack of patience in maintainance staff”
Reviews.Author: vineeta9
Reviews.Content: The toilet didn't flush, we repeatedly told the staff, it didn't help. Well, nothing else was bad. We found a restaurant named Spigolo right round the corner, Italian restaurant run by Italians. Food was great. I might go to stay there again just to go and eat at that place. :)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, a little noisy but clean and central”
Reviews.Author: SF_Thommo
Reviews.Content: We were only staying 2 nights and needed somewhere central. The location was great and although the room was extremely basic and small it served it's purpose. we booked a quad room, 2 bunk beds an ensuite and a small TV. I wouldn't stay if you are spending any lenght of time here but for a few nights it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel/motel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: R0bert999
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in countless hotels/motels in this price range around Australia & this has to be the worst. The bedsread & blanket don't appear to have ever been cleaned, there were crumbs in the bed & the mattress smelled. The bathroom floor tiles were mouldy & the water pressure so bad that I had to run around in the shower to get wet. The walls were grubby & the TV only worked when it wanted to. There is a no-refund policy which applies even to advance calculations. Leave the place to the hookers.

Reviews.Title: “2 Nightmares not to forget - AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: Spicy2007
Reviews.Content: Very bad accommodation...tiny room like matchbox, not enough space for our suite case, so noisy, and the window is locked unable to open it, god knows why?? No basic cutlery, tea/coffee facilities or a fridge which are a basic requirements for any en suite room/hotel room, which was shocking. Basically nothing there just tiny room with bed and bathroom which has no vanity and after taking shower you need to keep the door open to get rid of the steam as it doesn't have extractor fan.... on top of all, to watch a movie on the hotel movie channel we have to pay for it...UNBELIEVABLE. Certainly I DO NOT recommend it to anyone it is just a NIGHTMARE.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Thomson_aus
Reviews.Content: Tiny room - you walk in and the bed is at the front door, and the wall on the other side. Tiny bathroom, no toiletries provided. Towels had holes in them. This is an absolutely basic place to stay, no better than a backpackers hostel. Would not go back!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy as hell”
Reviews.Author: daithi01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and found the place to be in a good location (william st)which is a couple of mins walk to the cross.unfortunately the noise levels on the inside made it near impossible to sleep as it seems the cheap accomodation rates seemed to attract all types.Room was of a decent standard but what i thought was very strange and dangerous was that the window was locked shut with no way of opening so god knows what you were supposed to do in the event of a fire.Anyway, finally I would not use this accomodation again if I was staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Really, Really Awful”
Reviews.Author: BG11
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my partner as we were going out in Kings Cross that night, so we thought that it would be close by - and it looked relatively new from the outside. We didnt expect much beacuse of the price, but it was a truly awful stay. Once we arrived we were told that they had checked for our booking (made on [--]), and that they could not check it until the manager arrived - an hour later. So we just waited around until then. Once in the room, we found it to be dirty, small and old. Basically, i came to the conclusion that its main purpose would be for a cheap room for the working ladies on the cross. The airconditioner was HUGE and LOUD, the bathroom was bigger than the actual room, and you could hear evryting going on in the corridors - word for word. The next morning at 7am, despite booking the room for 2 nights to avoid having to check out early, the cleaner knocked on the door and told us to check out, when i told him we were staying for two nights, he told me i needed to go downstairs and book it, despite the fact i had. After ignoring the cleaner, we came back after lunch to find that we had been locked out of the room. This was sorted quite easily, but no apologies or refunds were given. Basically this Motel is run by incompetent people for those who are VERY budget consious. My advise to people who are thinking of staying here...DONT. There are much better places to stay in Sydney for that price or a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel. I didn't find Kings Cross really a bad area at all. Lots of shops and restaurants open late, lots of people around, i felt very safe there. This hotel is about 5 minutes walk to the Kings Cross train station, where in just a few minutes, you can be in the center of Sydney. No, it's not a Hilton, but it's also 1/6 the price. The room was very very basic. Almost like a prison cell, but it was totally clean, quiet and adequat size. The staff was friendly. Not much furniture in the room, just a cheap $5 chair, and a small counter. Not even a night table, but just fine. Good air conditioning and heat, but there was NO PHONE in the room. Remember, the price is 1/6 of the Hilton. I also liked that you could walk to the gay area on Oxford Street, about 20 minute walk. Lots of restaurants on the way there, and in that area. If you must be in central Sydney, be prepared to pay the price. Honestly, it's only a 5 minute walk and a 5 minute train from the Kings Cross station to central Sydney. I think the tran was about $2 Australian one way. I also walked to the Hard Rock Cafe, which was about a 15 minute walk away. They don't give shampoo, only a bar of soap, so bring your own shampoo and save. Overall, highly recommended for what it was. I'm told some of the rooms on high floors have a view of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but adequate bargain room in Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: giantsfan2
Reviews.Content: This is a new but budget hotel in the notorious Kings Cross section of Sydney. However it is not located on the main red light district street. The small room with bath was comfortable enough and clean but quite minimal. It had a queen bed and a bunk bed which took up most of the room. The air conditioner and alarm clock were hard to operate since they were wedged into small and inaccessible places. There was a cable TV but no phone. Some reading lights would have been nice. I had a spectacular view of the harbor, bridge, and opera house (not all rooms have it though) and I even saw a fireworks display as a bonus. For the price they charge for a Sydney CBD location, you can't complain - just be sure you know what you're getting!

HotelInfo.Name: Formule 1 Sydney East
HotelInfo.Address: 191-201 Williams Street | Kings Cross, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia (Formerly Formule 1 Kings Cross)
